quest.name: The Black Wolf's Ultimatum
journal: Minfilia is greatly concerned by recent developments concerning the council of the Alliance leaders.

In urgent tones, Minfilia reveals to you that Gaius van Baelsar has issued the Alliance leaders with an ultimatum. Even now, they are discussing how best to respond. Lest they make an uninformed decision and inadvertently seal Eorzea's doom, it is imperative that Minfilia be given an opportunity to plead her case. Make haste to the Royal Promenade and ask Bartholomew to admit you to the Fragrant Chamber.
Owing to your timely intervention, Eorzea's leaders have resolved to fight the Empire to the last. Return to the Waking Sands in Vesper Bay, and speak with Minfilia.
The path ahead is now clear─all that remains is to walk it. Join your fellow Scions in preparing for the battle to decide the future of the realm.
objectives: Speak with Bartholomew on the Royal Promenade.
Speak with Minfilia at the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Grim tidings, Forename. It seems that word of the Ultima Weapon's existence has already reached the Alliance leaders...in the form of an ultimatum. They have gathered in the Fragrant Chamber, and are deliberating their answer even as we speak.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Beleaguered as they are, I fear they may well elect to lay down their arms in the belief that surrender will spare their people untold suffering. Yet nothing could be further from the truth.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: That which the Black Wolf offers will doom Eorzea, not deliver it, and the leaders must be made aware of this. Let us hurry to them, Forename, and ensure that they do not act in ignorance of the consequences.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: The council of the Alliance leaders is presently in progress in the Fragrant Chamber. I must ask that you step away from the doors, madamsir.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: ...I'm sorry? You're here on behalf of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn!? A thousand pardons, my ladylord! Of course you may enter!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Bah! We keep treading the same ground.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Van Baelsar's demands are clear...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Alas, our minds are not.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've never been one to shy from a fight. But if this weapon of theirs can do all they claim...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: It has been five years since the Calamity, and our people have scarce begun to rebuild their lives.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Can we now, in good conscience, call upon them to risk what little they have left? I would spare them the pain of further conflict.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Conflict, I say, though that would imply forces set in opposition. If the combined might of three primals could not stay Garlemald's new terror...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: What meaningful resistance can we offer? We who struggle to quell the foes who rise up within our own borders...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Long have we fought the primals, but to what end? We strike them down at no small cost, only for them to rise again and again.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Are we to play this profitless game for the rest of days? I for one grow tired of it.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Mistake me not, I do not propose to trade one tyranny for another.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I love liberty. But conciliation need not mean oppression.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... Though neither of you cried “surrender,” your every word betokened it.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Not that I deny there is truth in what you say. Nor can I rightly claim that Ul'dah is ready to fight.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Refugees flood our gates, and beastmen swarm our land, while the great and the good do nothing. My Flames struggle to bear the burden.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I put on a grand show at the remembrance service, made all manner of lofty promises... I've made good on not a bloody one.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Do not blame yourself, Raubahn. You said only that which the people needed to hear. All present have done the same.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Our citizens had become lost to hope. If our words served to kindle it in them anew, better we speak than remain silent.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Our enemy condemns us for failing our people, yet what does he care for their well-being?

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: While we labored to rebuild their lives, the Black Wolf built instruments of murder with which to end them.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Her Majesty speaks true. For all our failings, the people's well-being has ever been our foremost priority.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: While none among us ever doubted that the Empire would one day resume its war, we scarcely had means enough to solve the problems of the present.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye, which is why we looked to others to safeguard our future─

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Scions of the Seventh Dawn. Alas, they are gone, and the Black Wolf is at our door.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Admiral, I fear you are mistaken!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Alphinaud? Minfilia? And─seven hells─MASTER GARLOND!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And you, dear friend...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: By Rhalgr... You're alive! All of you!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As we approached, I would swear I heard talk of surrender, but I know that cannot be! It is not the Eorzean way!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Hear me, my friends! Accepting the Garleans' offer to vanquish the primals would be folly.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Folly, I say, for might is not the answer to the primal threat. Indeed, the more the Empire exerts its strength, the worse matters will become.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Primals enter this world when mortals call upon them, and mortals are wont to appeal to a higher power when they are desperate.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Nothing is more certain to breed desperation in the beast tribes than the Garleans' proposed solution.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The true answer lies in a lasting peace, but the Garleans only know war and conquest. Should Eorzea fall into their hands, there will be such suffering as none can imagine.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We are not blind to the many challenges that each of your nations face. Yet you must not give in.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Aye! Remember five years ago, when you wagered all for the sake of the realm! Remember what you fought for, what you were willing to die for!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let the memories rekindle the fire in your heart, for Eorzea has need of it again!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Come what may, we Scions will never give up the fight.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And so I bid you stand with us, and together we shall safeguard the future of the realm!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: A great man once said that a shrewd merchant grasps not for the quick profit, but invests in the future. Wise words...eh, Raubahn?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Cid... I...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Your words stir...and shame me in equal measure. How could I contemplate surrender...?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I know full well that all we have, we owe to the sacrifices of those who went before us. Yet the seeming hopelessness of our plight robbed me of my insight.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: We Gridanians have no love for war...

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet we have still less for those who would threaten our homeland. Ever have we fought to protect those things we hold dear, and this shall never change.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Gridania will go to war. We will fight the Empire, for the sake of the realm and all who abide here!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Ahaha... Ahahahaha!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Hahaha! Hear, hear!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Hahahaha...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: At long last, I hear words worthy of a founder of the Alliance!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Raubahn! Are we to be outdone!?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I lost one homeland. The thought of losing another had blunted my resolve.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But no man knows better than I that if you want aught, you'd best be ready to die for it.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With great danger comes the chance for great glory, and great profit─we Ul'dahns, who have turned sand into gold, know this well.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: How many times have we fallen into the pit of despair, only to have you pluck us out? I've fair lost count.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Reckless, the lot of you─like bloody pirates! Well, I won't waste my breath trying to talk you 'round...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: ...On account of being a pirate myself. And the pirate who shrinks from a challenge is no pirate at all!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Those who would pick a quarrel with us must choose: back down, or go down with all hands.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Let the Garleans come. The united strength of Limsa Lominsa will be waiting for them!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: If our realm is to be free of this pall of darkness, let it be by our own hands!

dialogue.name: LEADERS
dialogue.text: (-Leaders-)For Eorzea!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: We must needs consider how the weapon may be brought to bear against us.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom will secure strategic points along the coastline.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In the meantime, the Flames will deploy at...

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Be at ease, my friends. You have banished our doubts.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Pray leave the military matters to us, and retire to the Waking Sands. We will send word anon.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: No text

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I cannot well express my relief. To think that the Alliance came so close to surrender...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But the fire in their hearts has been rekindled, and they will fight to the last.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This warmth inside... Did you feel it too, Grandfather?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I would know something─was that your power at work earlier?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Nothing of the sort. The leaders of Eorzea had lost their way─I merely helped them to find it again.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text:
Oh, hello!
...Yes, our party returned just a moment ago. How close are you?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It's all right, Cid.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must needs plan our next move. Pray continue liaising with your respective nations. Cid, would you be our man in Ul'dah?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'll be whatever and wherever you need me to be!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We haven't a moment to waste.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: All right! Let's do this!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred's fate weighs heavy on my mind. I cannot bear to think of him in thrall to an Ascian.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Mayhap you know this already, but the Ascians are immortal beings without physical form. Since time immemorial, they have fanned the flames of chaos from the shadows.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: That they might work unseen, the Ascians entrap and possess mortal men by means of malign artifacts known as Crystals of Darkness.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: One such Crystal may yet be the key to saving Thancred.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is a Crystal of Darkness?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A mere replica, created using data obtained from anomalous crystals found across Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It comes to us courtesy of the Students of Baldesion, our distant allies.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Even for an Archon, Thancred's talents are exceptional. We all had complete confidence in him.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It was for this reason that none among us foresaw the danger in sending him to investigate the Ascians alone.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Thancred had been striving to fill the void left by Louisoix. Yet it was plain that he was overtaxing himself.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Yeah... He would volunteer for everything and work till he was dizzy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And the toll taken by his exertions made him vulnerable to Ascian influence...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Crystal that binds Thancred must be somewhere on his person. If we could but destroy it, his Ascian possessor would be compelled to relinquish control over him.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You have proven the stoutest of allies, standing with us through thick and thin.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet the most perilous struggle is still to come. For the sake of the realm─and Thancred─I ask that you lend us your strength once more.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you lend your strength?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thank you. From the bottom of my heart.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As I am sure you are aware, the realm was saved from certain doom five years ago by heroes known as the Warriors of Light.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: What you may not be aware of is that your many feats in service to the Scions have prompted folk to make certain...comparisons.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I must confess, you do remind me of them.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: One can only wonder at their insight. Perhaps a touch of the Echo resides in everyone.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet remember this: however glorious the past, it is the hero's lot to be judged on the deeds of the present.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: A new darkness threatens the realm, and the people cry out for a savior.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I believe that you are shehe─a Warrior of Light, here in the present, guided by the Crystal's will.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Come, my friends! Let us fight to safeguard the future of our beloved Eorzea!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I meant to ask you. Are you, perchance, in possession of your own chocobo? I would be remiss to send you into a battle of this scale without a mount.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: If you do not, I would encourage you to procure one from your Grand Company as soon as you are able. I can guarantee you that it will serve you well to have your own steed.

dialogue.name: SISTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake the next main scenario quest, you must first complete the quest “My Little Chocobo  (MaelstromTwin AdderImmortal Flames).”

dialogue.name: SISTEM
dialogue.text: You may accept the quest “My Little Chocobo (MaelstromTwin AdderImmortal Flames)” by speaking with R'ashaht Rhiki at Maelstrom CommandVorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' NestCommander Swift at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No
